intro: Specularia speculum-veneris var. cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit, it is a popular subject in botanical studies and horticulture.
